intro: Hieracium eritephrum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieracium eritephrum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and woodland edges, thriving in well-drained soils.
